channel.title: I'm writing a book
channel.description:
I'm writing a book.
The book's title is "Aftermath:2016"
The book is about the aftermath of the soon to come 2012 solar flares. It follows the journey of two men through an underground Oasis found in New Zealand. It is apparently the only hospitable place left on earth.
I have currently got 1520 out of at least the 42000 words I am aiming for.
What should I do when it is finished?

item.title: I'm writing a book
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:19, topic:225716”][quote author=Unid H4x0r link=topic=296626.msg2385548#msg2385548 date=1218747762]
Don’t worry about the word count, if you have a story to tell, it’ll work out. The story sounds interesting. But can I suggest you change the gender of one character? It’ll create more depth to the story if the two have a relationship while they’re trying to do whatever they are doing.
[/quote]Ohgod a female character and relationships would make it suck major nigger dick. it would en up like all the shit you see on TV. Go back to the 1950-1980’s. Books were 99999999x better because they didn’t have much of that gay shit.[/quote]That’s the thing, you’re talking about the 50s-80s. If a book wants to get sold nowadays, you’ve gotta do what you’ve gotta do.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm writing a book
item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:2, topic:225716”]Burn it so that no one who survives the catalclismic event of 2012 will know of your hidden oasis.[/quote]unless we make it a law to read teh book!

on a serious note, it sounds like something i would read

Read full topic

item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

casey.:

thanks for the idea, I’m going to go copyright it now, as I did to Ticos projects.

Thanks for that by the way. I got sued for 20 thousand USD. Faggot.

[/sarcasm]

It’ll create more depth to the story if the two have a relationship while they’re trying to do whatever they are doing.[/quote]Ohgod a female character and relationships would make it suck major nigger dick. it would en up like all the shit you see on TV. Go back to the 1950-1980’s. Books were 99999999x better because they didn’t have much of that gay shit.

item.title: I'm writing a book
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:1, topic:225716”]I’m writing a book.

The book’s title is “Aftermath:2016”

The book is about the aftermath of the soon to come 2012 solar flares.
It follows the journey of two men through an underground Oasis found in New Zealand. It is apparently the only hospitable place left on earth.

I have currently got 1520 out of at least the 42000 words I am aiming for.

What should I do when it is finished?[/quote]

Read it, if its good make copies, if its crap - you just wasted a whole bunch of time!

Read full topic

item.title: I'm writing a book
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“SHANT_THE_MAN!, post:16, topic:225716”]I like the theme of the book, but what doesn’t make sense to me is the oasis in New Zealand location.

Oasis’s occur in deserts…[/quote]

The whole world is more or less a desert after a solar flare which burns everything to a crisp. (In my book at least)
I have 7,766 words now. I only write it at school and I aim for around 1,000 words a day.

There are also a few exciting revelations in chapter seven!

Read full topic

item.title: I'm writing a book
item.dc:creator: @SHANT_THE_MAN SHANT_THE_MAN!
item.description:
@SHANT_THE_MAN wrote:

I like the theme of the book, but what doesn’t make sense to me is the oasis in New Zealand location.

Oasis’s occur in deserts…

Read full topic

item.title: I'm writing a book
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:14, topic:225716”][quote author=Unid H4x0r link=topic=296626.msg2385548#msg2385548 date=1218747762]
Don’t worry about the word count, if you have a story to tell, it’ll work out. The story sounds interesting. But can I suggest you change the gender of one character? It’ll create more depth to the story if the two have a relationship while they’re trying to do whatever they are doing.
[/quote]
Oh, I forgot to mention. The reason they are traveling through this Oasis is to find Sig’s long lost chick friend from russia.

EDIT: I now have 4067 of 42000 words. I am on chapter four.[/quote]I’m inferring one of the dude’s name is Sig. Isn’t it kind of dull like that?

Read full topic

item.title: I'm writing a book
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Unid H4x0r:

Don’t worry about the word count, if you have a story to tell, it’ll work out. The story sounds interesting. But can I suggest you change the gender of one character? It’ll create more depth to the story if the two have a relationship while they’re trying to do whatever they are doing.

Oh, I forgot to mention. The reason they are traveling through this Oasis is to find Sig’s long lost chick friend from russia.

EDIT: I now have 4067 of 42000 words. I am on chapter four.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm writing a book
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:11, topic:225716”]Oh I know, I just saw it as an opportunity to make a quick laugh. I wasn’t making any shots at your character, or your morality.[/quote]I know, but I didn’t know how many people would understand me if I actually gave an non literal reply back to you.

casey.:

thanks for the idea, I’m going to go copyright it now, as I did to Ticos projects.

When is my work protected? Your work is under copyright protection the moment it is created and fixed in a tangible form that it is perceptible either directly or with the aid of a machine or device.
- http://www.copyright.gov/help/faq/faq-general.html#what

Good luck Casey.

Read full topic

Don’t worry about the word count, if you have a story to tell, it’ll work out. The story sounds interesting. But can I suggest you change the gender of one character? It’ll create more depth to the story if the two have a relationship while they’re trying to do whatever they are doing.
[/quote]

I didn’t know you liked underage sex.[/quote][sarcasm]Surprising huh?[/sarcasm] I thought it was a good critique… you just think negative.

item.title: I'm writing a book
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Unid H4x0r, post:7, topic:225716”]Don’t worry about the word count, if you have a story to tell, it’ll work out. The story sounds interesting. But can I suggest you change the gender of one character? It’ll create more depth to the story if the two have a relationship while they’re trying to do whatever they are doing.[/quote]I agree. Highschool life is going great for this girl and guy, and they really like each other, then DISASTER strikes, and they have to help each other, and build a relationship, to survive.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm writing a book
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

Don’t worry about the word count, if you have a story to tell, it’ll work out. The story sounds interesting. But can I suggest you change the gender of one character? It’ll create more depth to the story if the two have a relationship while they’re trying to do whatever they are doing.

item.title: I'm writing a book
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:5, topic:225716”]IMO it’s better that you make a story line first and make a list of characters and their info first. I think it’s easier to write that way and you will get a more complete story.

BTW, what readers are you aiming for? Age etc.[/quote]
I already have a storyline and characters. I have all of their info.

I am aiming for people aged around 13-16 or so. This story is more or less a project because I am bored.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm writing a book
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

IMO it’s better that you make a story line first and make a list of characters and their info first. I think it’s easier to write that way and you will get a more complete story.

BTW, what readers are you aiming for? Age etc.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm writing a book
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Try to complete it. But 1520 out of 42000 isn’t that much. When you finish it take it to a publisher and let them have some people test read it. If it’s good, it will get sold.

I started this morning. I only had like 10 minute blocks in which I could write it.

Read full topic
